This is my connection:

processing:

Content Modifier before:

 

This is from log:
odata:PATCH_ENTRY?serviceUri=${exchangeProperty.endpoint}/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_SALES_ORDER_SRV/
&resourcePath=RAW(A_SalesOrderItem(SalesOrder='0000000578',SalesOrderItem='000010'))
&alias=RAW(CUC_BO_SO_0109)
&authenticationType=Basic

&contentType=application/atom+xml

&validateSystemQueryOption=true

entry.title: Re: Problem with the CDS View "searchable" calculated column / case.. when column
entry.content:
The dump still happens in ABAP 7.58.

Impossible to use @search.defaultSearchElement: true on a column calculated by CASE ... END (whatever level this column appears in the cascaded CDS views).

Runtime error RAISE_SHORTDUMP, CX_SADL_DUMP_DATABASE_FAILURE:

  1. The program has indicated exception "CX_SADL_DUMP_DATABASE_FAILURE" as the reason for the termination: An unrecoverable error has occurred: See previous in exception chain. The exception is related to the previous exception "CX_SADL_GW_V2_FATAL_REQUEST" that occurred in program "SAPMHTTP", in line 0 of include "???".
  2. The reason for this exception was: Fatal error in SADL OData v2 request processing (mapping provider 'ZSD_OFFCOM') The exception is related to the previous exception "CX_SADL_SQL_EXECUTION" that occurred in program "CL_SADL_SQL_EXECUTOR_EXC_HNDLRCP", in line 2 of include "CL_SADL_SQL_EXECUTOR_EXC_HNDLRCM001".
  3. The reason for this exception was: Execution of a SADL-assembled SQL query failed, see previous exception The exception is related to the previous exception "CX_SY_OPEN_SQL_DB" that occurred in program "CL_SADL_SQL_EXECUTOR==========CP", in line 66 of include "CL_SADL_SQL_EXECUTOR==========CM00A".
  4. The reason for this exception was: The database has returned the SQL code 7. The error message is: feature not supported: CONTAINS predicates on expression CASE WHEN VBAK.SUBMI <> '1' THEN 'A' ELSE 'B' END.

SAP explanation (HANA limitation): 3232246 - feature not supported: CONTAINS predicates on expression "<expression>" - SAP for Me.

Problem also mentioned in this other question but still no solution: Search filed on a calculated field - SAP Community.

entry.title: Re: Group reporting: Unable to Consolidate correctly Equi...
entry.content:
Hello @TULLEYC 

Thanks, Colin, this is very helpful.

Brief response to your two points.

App name-
The app I meant is Manage Ownership Data (tile under Consolidation ‚Üí Ownership). App IDs differ by tenant and release, so don‚Äôt worry if you don‚Äôt see F3440.

Manage Consolidation Group Structure - Unit View

How to exclude indirect ownership from the investment-elimination rule so 172100 is not affected twice

Do two things:

Maintain ownership as direct-only in the master data.

In Manage Ownership Data, maintain only the direct links:

  • J0184 ‚Üí J0196: S0002 Direct Share = 30%
  • J0196 ‚Üí J0197: S0002 Direct Share = 40%

Do not keep a J0184 ‚Üí J0197 line at all (neither S0002 nor S0001)

Run Calculate Group Shares and Post Group Shares so the system derives the 12% indirectly for reporting, but there is no direct J0184‚ÜîJ0197 relationship for rules to trigger.

Restrict the elimination rule for 172100 to direct share only.

In configuration, Define Rules for the Elimination of Investments

Find the rule that removes FS item 172100 (Investments in Subs/JV/Associates) with document type 3A.

Set Share for calculation to Direct Share (S0002).
This ensures the rule doesn't apply to group or indirect shares.

Make sure the rule requires a Partner Consolidation Unit, meaning it only works when there's a direct parent‚Äìchild link.

For the Equity Method consolidation method, either:

Deactivate/remove any 172100-elimination row or keep it active only for subsidiary or proportionate methods, not for equity method methods.

Practical effect:
J0196‚ÜîJ0197 (direct) still eliminates 172100 once.
J0184‚ÜîJ0197 (indirect) won‚Äôt trigger because there's no direct link, and the rule only applies Direct Share.

Check your method assignment

For equity-accounted entities, use the provided Equity Method naming/numbers, which vary by content, but fall under the category Equity method.

Avoid using a Parent-Direct Shares method for equity-accounted investees; that method typically applies to full/prop subsidiaries and can unintentionally trigger 172100 elimination.

Carry out the sequence to verify.

Ownership: Calculate Group Shares ‚Üí Post Group Shares

Consolidation Monitor: 02 Prepare Group Structure Changes: changes should not affect the equity-method units ‚Üí 30 Consolidation of Investments

Check 172100 on J0197: you should see only one elimination in the direct J0196‚ÜîJ0197, not two.

SAP Help-Manage Data Ownership

Please let me know how it goes.

With regards

Chuma

I created a simple new project just clicking a button would add a report to an empty container.

Doing the same in my existing solution:

- ButtonClick will create an instance of a CRViewerControl and add it to the groupcontrol.
- runs fine on development machine, but error on target machine.

Conclusion:
something not in VS2022 is still using 13.0.26. but something in my existing solution.

entry.title: Re: How to enable the Event Mesh from the BTP Integration Suite with S/4 Hana Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hi @Hanumath,

I'm not an expert in licensing topics.
Here is what I found exploring different sources:

This blog - Partner TDD Onboarding for SAP S/4HANA Cloud, public edition ‚Äì Guide for Common Issues which should answers all your queries on TDD.
If you've partner portal access, you can find list of TDD and Pricing and also whom you can contact and discuss.

Event Mesh has a standalone TDD SKU: 8008807.

Event Mesh is available as an add-on service for the Cloud test, demo, and development for SAP Business Technology Platform, starter pack (SKU: 8011000).

Furthermore, Event Mesh is part of the Pay-As-You-Go for SAP BTP for Cloud Test, Demo, and Development portfolio and can be activated as a standalone service in an PAYG TDD Global Account.

Not sure if this is all up-to-date or already outdated. But it should give you at least a starting point.

Best regards,
Tobias

entry.title: Re: How can I customize the standard 001 for the Person R...
entry.content:
Got it. So you are not trying to change the default that appears in CR01/CR02 for everyone, you want to keep the key ‚Äú001‚Äù but have its description/meaning differ by plant location. In standard SAP, the ‚ÄúPerson Responsible‚Äù field in the work center (technical field VERAN) is a key from a plant‚Äëspecific customizing table. That‚Äôs why you can maintain different texts for the same key in different plants.

Go to op10, select your plant, for that plant, maintain the key 001 with the description you want for that plant. Repeat for each plant location like Plant A ‚Üí 001 = ‚ÄúJohn Smith‚Äù and Plant B ‚Üí 001 = ‚ÄúJane Doe‚Äù, etc. Save the transport.

For information, the ‚ÄúPerson Responsible‚Äù list is plant‚Äëdependent in this customizing. When you create or change a work center in CR01/CR02 for a given plant, the F4 help for Person Responsible will show the entries for that plant. You can therefore have the same key (001) mean different people in different plants without affecting other plants.

entry.title: Re: TDS provisioning
entry.content:
Hello @Rishav4 

Thank you for your follow-up and for sharing the screenshot. It is very helpful

Yes, your screenshot shows the right configuration path for rounding differences in S/4HANA Public Cloud.

Configuration app: Automatic Account Determination Area: Financial Accounting ‚Üí General Ledger Accounting ‚Üí Resolve Differences for Open Items
Transaction Group: G/L (General Ledger) account clearing ‚Üí Differences arising in G/L account clearing
Here, you maintain the rounding-difference G/L accounts (debit/credit) according to the Chart of Accounts. This is exactly where the posting key for cents is used to goes.

Why did the rounding difference appear

Even when the business amounts appear clean, a cent can be created due to the way SAP calculates and rounds:

Item-level rounding versus summary-level rounding

Conversion to the company code currency occurs per line item and is rounded to the currency‚Äôs decimal places.

When you clear multiple items, the system sums the locally rounded amounts; the total may vary by ¬±0.01 or ¬±1 for zero-decimal currencies.

Various decimal places

Examples: JPY (0 decimal places), KWD (3 decimal places) versus company code currency with 2 decimal places ‚áí rounding during conversion/clearing.

Foreign currency and rate timing

Original item posted at the rate on the document date; clearing at the clearing date or with a payment in transaction currency can cause a slight difference even if the transaction currency net is zero.

Cash discount and taxes in clearing

If a discount per payment terms/tolerances or tax recalculation occurs, the discount or tax line is calculated and rounded, leaving a cent on the balance line.

Tolerance settings enable automatic clearance with write-off

If the difference falls within your employee tolerance for clearing, SAP automatically posts it to the rounding G/L account you specified above.

Quick checks to pinpoint the exact cause

In Clear G/L Accounts (or in the created clearing document via Manage Journal Entries), open the processing/clearing log and compare document currency with company code currency per line.

Verify the currency of each open item, the exchange rate applied, and whether a discount was given.

Review tolerance groups for employees so you know whether the cent was auto written off, and confirm that both debit and credit rounding accounts are set for your Chart of Accounts YSDA in the node you showed.

Let me know if it works

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: CRforVS stuck forever on 13.0.26? (type initializer f...
entry.content:
sorry for bloating the board, but maybe this will help someone in the future.

It seems I do have a solution - needs some more testing.
If so... it's above my paygrade to understand *why* this would happen and maybe it is something that should be fixed by SAP even?

I used tracking tool to follow exception and the following dll was called by CrystalDecisions.Shared.SharedUtils:
log4net.dll v.2.0.17.0 for .net 4.5
It is in the folder "\packages" of my solution folder and much younger than the CRforVS2019-installation has been
I need to check my documentation about where this comes from or what it is for; chance is: I have not even been aware of it.

I copied it to the output directory on the target machine (same folder as the solution.exe) and now the reports run fine so far with 13.0.38, but I will make further tests.

And: It still does not explain sufficiently, why the solution would run with runtime 13.0.26. on the target machine, while being built with 13.0.38

entry.title: Preliminary What‚Äôs New and Product Assistance for SAP S/4HANA and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition
entry.content:
The preliminary version of What's New information and Product Assistance is now available, to allow customers and partners to preview the upcoming new and changed features of SAP S/4HANA and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2025.

You can find this preview on the current SAP Help Portal pages of SAP S/4HANA and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition.

To access the preliminary What‚Äôs New information, please use What's New Viewer for SAP S/4HANA or What's New Viewer for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition.

For any feedback you may have, try the Commenting feature for What's New information in this release. To use this feature, you need to be logged into the SAP Help Portal. The feature is only available in the English version of the documents. To learn more about how the feedback process works in SAP Help Portal, see Giving Documentation Feedback.

entry.title: Re: Pricing - Condition activate with requirements
entry.content:
Hi @EdoTama ,

Let say you create a new item and the condition type Z001 has a requirement routine 902, here's what happens during pricing:

After entering Material and Quantity, you press Enter. The system calls Function Module PRICING.

    • Requirement Routine 902 is executed.
    • At this point, TKOMV[] is not yet filled, so the condition ZPRO is missing.
    • As a result, Requirement 902 fails, and Condition Z001 is not added to XKOMV[], and therefore not to TKOMV[] either.

By the end of the PRICING function, TKOMV[] is populated, and now includes the ZPRO condition.

So when you double-click the item, the system performs pricing again. This time, TKOMV[] is already filled from the first call. Hence, SUBRC = 0 (requirement check passes). However, condition Z001 is not redetermined at this point.

To force a new pricing determination, you need to manually click Update, or change a field that triggers pricing, or change a field and use the user exits to trigger your new pricing: USEREXIT_NEW_PRICING_VBAP / USEREXIT_NEW_PRICING_VBKD .

If you want automatic pricing redetermination without manual action, consider using: USEREXIT_CHECK_VBAP and PERFORM PREISFINDUNG(SAPFV45P) USING your_newpricing (could be B or C based on your setup).   

This forces a new pricing during item check.

Let me know if could help!
Thanks,
Dan

entry.title: Standard SAP input fields have a limitation of 255 characters, for QR code processing need more
entry.content:
Standard SAP input fields have a limitation of 255 characters. For QR code processing, we require an input field capable of handling up to 600 characters in RF- Screen. While a custom control was developed In Module Pool Program and functional in SAP GUI, it fails to render in ITS Mobile environments, displaying compatibility error messages., While Doing Configurations as While Creating HTML Template by following Details Internet Service : ZMOB Theme : 99HTML Template Name : ZWM_FG_LT1F Screen Number : 9002 Generating Style : Mobile Device ( No HTML Tables )


--- Steps to Reproduce ---

Login the RF transaction: 

  1. LM01. 
    1. Inbound process
    2. Putaway verification
      1. Scan Pallet code
      2. QR code verification field (item) is not enabled in the WebURL/in Device (ITS Zebra device).

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Public Cloud Alternative for FM DDIF_FIELDINFO_GET?
entry.content:
There's no direct replacement in ABAP Cloud, so it depends on what information you need from DDIF_FIELDINFO_GET.

You may access a partial list of the ABAP Dictionary attributes via RTTS (CL_ABAP_*DESCR classes), like the length, the type, structure components and so on, but you can't use the following four RTTS methods because they raise the runtime error CALL_METHOD_NOT_PERMITTED:

  • GET_DDIC_FIELD of CL_ABAP_ELEMDESCR
  • GET_DDIC_OBJECT and GET_DDIC_HEADER of CL_ABAP_TYPEDESCR
  • GET_DDIC_FIELD_LIST of CL_ABAP_STRUCTDESCR
  • There's a comment in the ABAP code of all these methods: "Calling get_ddic_field by a method with language version ABAP for SAP Cloud Platform results in the runtime error call_method_not_permitted."
  • All other RTTS methods are supported in It's the only method concerned in this class.
  • NB: the method GET_DDIC_FIELD_VALUES of CL_ABAP_ELEMDESCR is supported in ABAP Cloud.
  • NB: such error is mentioned in this question: Hi All,The class CL_ABAP_TYPEDESCR is released API... - SAP Community.
  • I didn't check the other RTTS classes (CL_ABAP_*_DESCR) but there's no other method named GET_DDIC_*.

There are also the following methods in the class XCO_CP_ABAP_DICTIONARY to get the specific ABAP Dictionary attributes: DATABASE_TABLE, STRUCTURE, DATA_ELEMENT, etc.

entry.title: Re: SAP Fiori for SAP S/4HANA ‚Äì Which notification to use when ‚Äì Workflow, Situation Handling, KPIs,
entry.content:
If anyone else would like to reproduce the issue in their system and report this to SAP, here's how you reproduce it:

  1. Identify a task for which work items are created in your system
  2. Use transaction SWF_PUSH_NOTIF_CUST to define a customized "Text to display when notifications are grouped together"
 
Expected result:
Notifications > By Type uses the customized text
Fiori settings > Notifications uses the customized text
 
Actual result:
Notifications > By Type uses the customized text
Fiori settings > Notifications does not
 
 
In more general terms the above expected and actual results can be described as:
 
Expected result:
The text in Fiori settings > Notifications is the same as the heading in Fiori notifications > By Type so the user knows which entry to disable in the settings to stop receiving a certain type of notifications.
 
Actual result:
The text in Fiori settings > Notifications is not the same as the heading in Fiori notifications > By Type and the user can't tell which entry to disable in the settings to stop receiving a certain type of notifications.

The way to do this is to bypass the UI completely using the OData API.

entry.title: Competencies & PG Forms
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

I have a client who currently has competencies configured and mapped, and an ongoing Performance campaign.

They now want to change all the competencies in order to launch the 2026 performance campaign with a new competency structure.

My understanding is that if I remove all the existing competencies from the Centre of Capabilities or the Job Profile Builder, the already launched performance forms will remain unaffected and will still display the old competencies.

So the expected result would be:

  • 2025 performance forms: still show the old competencies (even though they have been removed or replaced in the Centre of Capabilities)
  • 2026 performance forms: show the new competencies

    Does everyone agree with this approach?

    Also, if you see any risks or other potential impacts in carrying out this operation, please let me know.

    Thank you in advance for your help üòä

    Kind regards,
    Serena

entry.title: Re: S4HC Public Cloud Eclipse created CDS and AMDP
entry.content:
Hello @peter_munt4 

Many thanks for the follow-up. In on-premise S/4HANA, you control the ABAP OAuth server and can enable OAuth 2.0 for any OData service.

In S/4HANA Public Cloud, inbound OAuth is only available for communication scenarios that SAP has enabled. SAP_COM_0303 does not offer OAuth; it only supports Basic or Client Certificate. Your options in Public Cloud include using Client Certificate/Basic directly or placing SAP API Management in front to expose OAuth and then forwarding to S/4 with cert/basic authentication behind it.

Your 3-tier landscape does not change these auth limits.

Let me know if you have further information.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Business Partner Replication from S/4HANA Public Cloud to EWM fails due to missing General Role
entry.content:
Hello experts,

We are currently facing an issue with Business Partner replication via DRF from S/4HANA Public Cloud to a decentral SAP EWM system.

Scenario

  • In S/4HANA Public Cloud, when we create a Business Partner (with Customer and/or Vendor roles), the General role (000000) is not visible/maintained in the frontend.

  • When replicating this BP via DRF , the message is successfully sent from S/4HANA Cloud.

  • However, in EWM inbound processing , the message fails with an Application Error.

Error Log in EWM

In transaction SRT_MONI, we see the following details:

 

Analysis

  • EWM requires the General BP role (000000) to be present in order to assign and process additional roles (Customer, Vendor, etc.).

  • In S/4HANA Public Cloud, this General role seems to be handled internally, but it is not explicitly replicated via DRF.

  • As a result, the EWM inbound proxy cannot process the payload and throws the application error.

Questions

  1. Is there an official fix or SAP Note that covers this gap (e.g., automatic inclusion of General role during DRF replication)?

  2. If not, do we need to build a custom solution (BAdI / extension in S/4HANA Public Cloud or EWM) to enrich the payload with BP role 000000 before EWM processes it? If yes, is this only possible on the EWM side?

  3. Can confirm whether this scenario is supported out-of-the-box, or if it is out of scope for standard S/4HANA Cloud ‚Üî EWM integration?

Additional Context

  • The issue is reproducible with any new BP replication.

  • In S/4HANA Cloud, the DRF message monitor shows successful processing, but the EWM side always fails with the error mentioned.

  • We already verified that the inbound service BusinessPartnerSUITEBulkReplicateRequest_In is active and the communication arrangement is correct.

Any insights, SAP Notes, or confirmation from SAP would be highly appreciated.

Thanks in advance,

entry.title: Re: Payment term block issue

I don't know a validity date in T052, there is a 'obsolete' flag to prevent display in input search-help (oss notes can be required if not up-to-date, such as 3272937 - Obsolete payment terms are displayed in payment terms Searchhelp in Manage Purchase orders app. or 2401700 - FI: Hiding obsolete entries in input helps for terms of payment)

If you want to prevent their use, consider Validation rules (FI) or BAdI (MM) but first, establish precise management rules (for example, in the event of a document cancellation or modification).

entry.title: SAP Public Cloud: Professional Service Project Amount total update
entry.content:
We wanted to update the amount total of the Project we created under professional service by creating a credit memo and reducing its amount.

When I try to create a credit memo and post it to Accounting, I notice that it does not update the project even though I create it with reference to an existing posted invoice.

 

I notice that the WBS Element created is being substituted and although part of the Project, it is not part of the work package created inside my project. I think this is the reason why it is not updating the Customer Project amount.

 

When I check the log during billing document creation, this is the message I saw: Revenue of leading WBS element CXXXX determined by substitution from CXXXX.

 

Can you be able to help where to check this? 

 

Thank you.

entry.title: S4 Public Cloud - Embedded Steampunk - Custom Adobe Form from scratch
entry.content:
Hello, 

I'm working on an S4 Public Cloud project using an Embedded Steampunk (RAP) environment. I need to build an app from scratch with a button to print a PDF form.

Therefore, I cannot use any predefined form templates. I must create a custom template and a custom data source, all from scratch, and then be able to use it from my RAP app.

I've reviewed note 3356705 (https://me.sap.com/notes/3356705/E), which states that it's not possible to upload templates with the Maintain Form Templates app because a custom data source cannot be used. Therefore, I would assume it's not possible.

But I also reviewed note 3355397 (https://me.sap.com/notes/3355397/E). This note states that, starting with version 2508, the CL_FP_FORM_READER class exists to work with forms using ADTs (RAP).

The problem is that if I can't upload forms from scratch and data sources from scratch, am I still unable to create and work with custom forms from my custom apps?

The notes are a bit confusing. Does anyone know if this is now possible without using the Adobe Forms BTP service? That is, by creating the custom forms directly in the S4 Public Cloud.

Thanks a lot. 

Kind Regards.

entry.title: Scalable Employee Document Repository using nested MDF Objects - Exploring Custom MDF Potential
entry.content:
Overview / Business challenges

The requirement is to store employee documents which are categorized as per the year and document category. There are various solutions available with SAP BTP however, for the clients who do not have BTP License, it could be a challenge.

Also, Manage Documents Functionality cannot be used in this scenario as it comes with following challenges ‚Äì

  1. It is difficult to manage and maintain document categories under Manage Documents.
  2. The UI of Manage Documents is not very intuitive and user friendly.
  3. There are Data privacy concerns as well under Manage Documents as all the documents will be visible to the employees having access to Manage Documents.

Solution Overview

1. Custom MDF Creation

A MDF Based portlet is built and attached on the employee profile tagged to each employee to store the respective documents. The documents can be added to different years by selecting the year from the dropdown and then adding the documents relevant to that particular year. The documents can be categorized by selected the relevant option from the dropdown of the field ‚Äì Document Category. The portlet can be permissioned via Role Based Permissions controlling who can view the portlet and can edit/add documents within the same.

The solution details further with the creation of 3 custom MDF object having Parent Child Relationship. Although there is a limitation to have three of more child objects on Custom UI ( 2969227 - MDF Object not appearing in Manage configuration UI ), the arrangement of the objects on the UI as described below helped overcome this challenge.

Details of the objects are as per below:

  • Custom Object 1 ‚Äì Employee Document Repository (Master Parent Object): The object is created with external code of type User which links the repository to the employees. The object is associated with another custom object ‚Äì Document Year.

  • Custom Object 2 ‚Äì Document Year (Child Object): The object is created with external code of type Auto Number and a custom field as picklist to capture the year for the documents. The object is associated with the grandchild custom object ‚Äì Add Document.

Custom Object 2 ‚Äì Document Year (Secondary Parent Object):

  • Custom Object 3 ‚Äì Add Document (Grandchild Object): The object is created with external code of type Auto Number, custom field of type picklist to capture the document category and a custom field of type Attachment. The object is associated with the child custom object ‚Äì Add Document.

Custom Object 3 ‚Äì Add Document (Child Object)

The picklist for Document Category can be customized as per client requirements. Broadly, it can have values like Certifications, Dependents, Education, Others etc.

2. Custom UI for the Object

A Custom UI is created based on the Master Parent Object ‚Äì Employee Document Repository and then added on the people profile under a separate view. The accessibility of the custom MDF portlet on the employee profile can be controlled via Role Based Permissions Framework.

To have better UI Experience, use grouping of fields and custom objects.

Properties for Base Object Group:

Properties for Middle Object Group:

Properties of the child object group:

 

3. Adding Documents on the People Profile

  • Go to Employee Profile and scroll to Employee Document Repository section. Click on the pencil icon next to Document Repository to add/update the documentation.
  • A pop-up window opens which will have the documents segregated based on years in collapsed mode by default.

  • Expand the existing years to view/add/update the documents or click on Add button to add another year for which the documents need to be added.
  1. Expand the Document Details to view the existing document to edit/update.
  2. Click on Add to add new document for the expanded year (i.e., 2024 in this case as per below screenshot)

  • After click on Add button, select the document category from the document and upload the attachment. Click on SAVE.

Note: The Document Category contains basic data as of now which can be extended to have additional values as per the requirement of customer.

  •  Adding a new document year and add documents to that year ‚Äì

  • After clicking on add ‚Äì a new collapsed section ‚ÄúDocument Repository‚Äù is created.

  • Expand the section and select the year from the dropdown:

  •  Selecting the year from the dropdown will update ‚ÄúDocument Repository‚Äù to the selected year.

Follow the details in step 4 and step 5 to add the document details and click on SAVE.

4. Limitations:

  • The collapsible mode works only in the edit mode. On the employee profile, all the documents will be visible.

  • The documents will be arranged automatically in the order they get added to the portlet and will not get automatically sorted in reverse chronological order. If the records need to be rearranged, it can be done via Manage data > Employee Document Repository > Search by Employee.

5. Value Proposition and Conclusion

To summarize, in order to achieve the document repository, we harnessed the capabilities of Metadata Framework functionality to create three nested MDF objects & created picklists to categorize the documents based on year and document type. The solution is easily scalable not only for document repository but can be referenced for achieving custom solutions having the need for nested MDF objects.

This solution meets the business requirement with the already available functionalities within the standard licensing and hence, does not require additional licenses (for instance SAP BTP) to achieve the same for the basic repository functionality.

entry.title: How SAP Fiori transforms the user experience in Public cloud
entry.content:
Hello Readers,
Today we will discuss about, How SAP Fiori transforms the user experience in Public cloud.

Now a days businesses want software that is not only powerful but also easy to use. SAP Fiori makes SAP systems user-friendly and simple to work.

What is SAP Fiori?
SAP Fiori is SAP's revolutionary user experience, design language that completely transforms how people interact with SAP software. Instead of the traditional complex SAP screens with multiple fields and confusing navigation.

How Fiori Transforms your Daily Work?

  1. Works on any Devices-
    • Work on your Smartphone and Tablet anywhere, as it is portable to carry.
    • Access everything from your laptop at home.
  2. No Training required-
    • Easy to learn for new employees.
    • Employees enjoy using the software.
  3. Personalized for business-
    • Business most used applications appear front.
    • Customizable dashboard shows what matters to business.
    • Smart notifications.

SAP FIORI used in various business process such as:

Market Survey Insights: Why Move from Traditional SAP Screens to Fiori?

  1. According to market surveys, most businesses face the same challenge with traditional SAP GUI are as:
    • Complex to use as complex screens with hundreds of fields.
    • Limitations using Mobile as interfaces weren't designed for smartphones and tablets
    • Productivity loss as simple tasks took multiple steps and screen navigation.
  2. According to Studies those organizations using Fiori experience:
    • Higher user satisfaction as Fiori works on any device and looks modern user interface.
    • Improved decision-making with built-in, real-time analytics.
    • Lower training costs as the interface is easy to learn in a less time.
    • 30 to 40% faster task completion due to intuitive, role-based design.

Disadvantages:

  • Role & Authorization maintenance as miss or wrong roles can block app access.
  • Slower in poor internet connectivity areas.
  • More Setup efforts as Requires backend & frontend configuration.
  • Requires supported browsers as performance varies if outdated.
  • Limitations in customization and app-to-app navigation.
  • End user using GUI need adaptation time to learn Fiori tiles.

How SAP Fiori performs other Non-SAP products in user experience:

SAP Fiori in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud gives a smoother and smarter experience than many other non-SAP products.

SAP Fiori in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud delivers a cleaner, faster, and more connected user experience compared to many non-SAP systems. It gives each user only the apps and data they need, keeps the same look and feel across all business areas, and shows live information powered by SAP HANA.

Fiori works seamlessly on any device, connects all processes in one system to avoid data gaps, stays current with regular updates, includes built-in help, and provides strong, enterprise-level security-helping users work smarter and more efficiently.

How SAP Fiori Connects in the Background:

  • User Access: Open the Fiori Launchpad in a web browser using a secure connection (HTTP/HTTPS).
  • Front-End Layer: The launchpad, containing the app designs (SAPUI5), is hosted on the SAP Front-End Server or built into S/4HANA Public Cloud.
  • OData Communication: Clicking a tile sends a request through SAP Gateway using OData services.
  • Backend Processing: The Gateway passes this request to the S/4HANA backend, which runs the ABAP business logic using tools like CDS views, BAPIs, or function modules.
  • Database Access: The backend retrieves or updates information from the SAP HANA database in real time.
  • Return Path: The data is sent back through the Gateway and displayed in your browser by SAPUI5.
  • Security: Access is secured with methods like SAML 2.0, OAuth, or SAP Logon Tickets, and controlled through roles and permissions.

In Public Cloud, all these components (Fiori, Gateway, backend logic, and database) are part of one system, making the process faster, seamless, and secure.

Conclusion: SAP Fiori transforms the SAP experience from complex, desktop-bound screens to a modern, intuitive, and mobile-ready interface. It improves productivity, reduces training time, and delivers real-time insights‚Äîhelping users work smarter and faster. While it requires proper setup and stable internet, its seamless integration, consistent design, and role-based personalization make it a clear upgrade over both traditional SAP GUI and many non-SAP solutions. In the Public Cloud, its built-in architecture ensures speed, security, and a unified user experience across all devices.

Another issue is the requirement to limit user session durations. We would also like to know how to do this.

entry.title: Re: LMS Time zone issue in classes
entry.content:
Hi @ShaunL ,

Please note that Course Home (which is universal since the 2H2023 release), disregards the settings "Always display Classes in this Time Zone" and "Default to User's Time Zone for display of Classes".

https://help.sap.com/docs/successfactors-learning/managing-sap-successfactors-learning-for-administrators/always-display-classes-in-learner-time-zone?version=2505

  • "In 2018, we released Course Home, which is the next generation of learner experience with courses. Course Home ignores the Always display Classes in this Time Zone setting to simplify your configuration. In Course Home, SAP SuccessFactors Learning displays the time in local time, not based on the static setting in the preferences."

https://help.sap.com/docs/successfactors-learning/managing-sap-successfactors-learning-for-administrators/course-home-uses-local-time?version=2505

  • "In Course Home, you can think of course start and end times as train schedules or other schedules where the user is physically present for the timetable. A train departing at Noon in Heidelberg would show Noon regardless of where the user is because the user is physically present in Heidelberg to catch the train."

So, considering your class is set with the UTC timezone (at the class's record > Details tab > Class Time Zone), this is the class's local time. Hence, this is the time zone the class will be displayed to the users through a library search. However, this behavior changes when the class is considered by the system as virtual. That is, for virtual classes, the users will see the classes' schedule in their own time zones.

To make a class be considered as virtual, it's possible to set to 'Yes' the setting 'Show Virtual Class indicator to users', at the class's record > Details tab. With that, the class's header will show "Virtual Class: Yes" and at the Library, the users will see the class's schedule in their own time zone.

There have been some enhancement requests on this topic. Feel free to vote for any open ones or raise additional requests (as per 2090228) : 

  • https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/idea/284956
  • https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/idea/323381

Best regards,

entry.title: Discrepancy between Service Entry Sheet (SES) cost distribution amounts and Invoice Posting amounts

Discrepancy between Service Entry Sheet (SES) cost distribution amounts and Invoice Posting amounts for a service P.O. with quantity 1 and amount 842,000. Pricing conditions and tolerances have been checked.

 

Please advise on possible causes and solutions for differences in cost center distribution amounts between SES and invoice posting in SAP MM/PS, focusing on rounding, distribution keys, and invoice posting logic.

entry.title: Re: Issue with Maintenance Order Cost Reports ‚Äì Costs Shi...
entry.content:
Hello @Satyajit_Mohanty17 

Here‚Äôs what might be going on and how to sort it out, straight to the point.

The reasons for the August 30‚Äì31 costs appear in September.

Cost reports for maintenance orders are grouped by posting date or financial period. If users post late on 01‚Äì02 Sep or August has closed for FI/MM, the system assigns those entries to the period 09/2025, even if the document or work date is 30‚Äì31 Aug. Typical offenders:

Late postings of goods issues, service entry acceptance, or operation confirmations entered on 01‚Äì02 September

August's posting period has closed (FI or MM), so entries have defaulted to September.

Confirmation date does not equal posting date (users saved confirmations in September).

Report/extract uses posting date/period, not document/performance date.

Less common: time zone or user defaults causing posts to be made after midnight.

What to verify in below quick checks

Posting date (BUDAT) of each FI/material/confirmation line. Open the order, then navigate to Manage Journal Entries and display Material Documents; verify that BUDAT is 01/02-Sep for these items.

Period status: in Manage Posting Periods ‚Äì GL and Manage Posting Periods ‚Äì MM, check that August 2025 was not closed when users posted.

Confirmation postings: In Analyse Maintenance Order Costs / Display Actual Costs, verify the posting date of labour confirmations against their work/performance date.

Extraction filter
Ensure your report or Power BI extract filters by the intended field (Posting Date vs Document Date). Mixing them causes the ‚Äúmissing last two days‚Äù issue.

Sanity-check user defaults or company code time zone; although rare, it can cause a late-night entry to spill over into the next day.

How to correct it (choose one)

Operational fix preferable
Reopen in August FI and MM if policy permits, reverse and repost those few items with the correct August posting date.

Pragmatic accounting fix:
Leave postings in September and book a month-end adjustment (manual journal) to shift the cost from September to August on the order/cost centre (if materiality justifies)

Process fixes to prevent recurrence:

 Keep August open for back-posting during the first business days of September (per your close calendar).

Train users to set the posting date to the actual service/GI date before saving.

For confirmations, ensure the posting date matches the performance date when applicable.

Let me know if you need further support

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Proactive Safety Management with SAP EHS Incident Management
entry.content:
Videos on proactive safety management and on SAP EHS Incident Management:

Proactive Safety Management
SAP EHS Incident Management

How do Incident management and safety culture benefit from integrated software solutions?

Despite decades of improvements in safety management, accident rates in many companies have stagnated. The traditional causes of accidents ‚Äì technical, organizational, and personal factors ‚Äì are often marginal today. Instead, it is behaviour-related causes that play a central role. Classical accident management recognizes known causes but usually only intervenes after an event occurs and neglects unknown hazards and risky situations.

Proactive Safety Culture through Transparency and Participation

To sustainably improve the safety level in companies, a proactive safety culture is required that promotes transparency and the active participation of all employees. Here, a software solution like SAP EHS Incident Management plays a central role. This integrated solution enables all operational areas of the company to be made transparent and involves employees by allowing them to record different types of incidents such as accidents, near-misses, and safety observations.

From Reactive to Proactive Action

Safety cultures in companies differ in their approach to accidents. Reactive action only occurs after accidents, preventive action addresses known hazards, while proactive action aims to identify potential hazards early and prevent accidents. To achieve this, transparency is essential. The recording of events ‚Äì not just accidents, but also near-misses and safety observations ‚Äì is a central factor.

A study by ConocoPhillips1 Marine shows the quantitative relationship between accidents, near-misses, and safety observations. According to the study, one would have to expect 300,000 so-called 'at risk behaviours‚Äô per fatal accident. The actual accidents are only the tip of the iceberg. The hazard potential is many times greater. Before an accident, risky behaviours often occur, such as disregarding safety precautions, which, if detected, can indicate the potential for accidents. These insights underscore the need to identify hazards early and take proactive measures to prevent serious accidents.

Experts in the field of occupational safety emphasize that the role of management and employee engagement are crucial for the development of a proactive safety culture. A central element is behaviour-based safety (BBS), which aims to eliminate dangerous behaviours and strengthen safety-promoting behaviours among employees. By creating a comprehensive reporting culture within the company, the path to a proactive safety culture is paved.

SAP EHS Incident Management: The Tool for Proactive Safety Culture

SAP EHS Incident Management is an essential building block for a proactive safety culture and behaviour-based safety. This solution provides transparency about all hazards in the company by recording, analysing, and managing accidents, near-misses, and safety observations across all organizational units.

Thanks to integration with HR management, asset management, finance, as well as the organizational and location structure, events can be precisely located and evaluated. The application simplifies the reporting of incidents and ensures that all required information is captured through mandatory fields and validated data selection. By analysing incident statistics, probabilities for serious accidents can be identified early and reduced through preventive measures.

SAP EHS Incident Management is more than just a software solution ‚Äì it is the central building block for establishing a proactive safety culture that prevents accidents before they happen.

  • ConocoPhillips Marine: Safety Pyramid based on a study, April (2003)
